title: Stellar!  Great features and Watch Compl.
content:
UPDATE.  Fantastical is still the best but
I also use my other calendar app 24me still because it has live links for tasks in the pop-up notifications - so I can take action like make the phone call, send e-mail, etc. directly from the notification pop-up window or within the calendar app. And for the notes that use basic word process and images.  

Fantastical is my go-to, day to day, hard working, heavy lifter.  

Original review:

I have 1000s of apps and I beta test several.  This app is so useful and user friendly!  I had a heavy favorite, paid upgrade, calendar/task app but I've switched over to Fantastical 2.  Most important in this choice is a large Watch Complication that shows BOTH the next Event or Task, almost all others only show events - useless.  Easy to use Watch app.  

Beyond the many powerful features, I love that the phone interface has a full month view with dynamic corresponding details listed below - one view without the other isn't useful.  Great navigation. 

Once you learn the super simple way to enter details with creating an Event it's a blast!  No need to mess with settings, just write in Event, date, etc, in a sentence and it's done.  Watch the brief video here in the App desc.  AWESOME

It's great to be able to choose which apps I want the map links and browser links to open with.  All the browsers on my phone are available.  Wow!  Big plus, don't have to use Apple maps.  (Hate Apple Maps and had deleted it but many apps can only use Apple Maps).

Fantastical 2 is extremely well designed and maintained.  Great (fast) sync with the Watch Compl. and in general with all other tasks, reminders, and  calendars I have.  Powerful and stable.  Reliable. And just cool to use.  

Creating Reminders from e-mail would be handy.  My other app is cross platform - Android etc. but no Mac OS. But those are not deal or star rate breakers.

Got the iPad app. A very rare purchase for me to pay separately for iOS.  I want to support great work.  I can't afford the Mac OS app. I'm confident it's excellent too.

Thanks for a great app!!

title: Almost perfect
content:
Update 04.03.24:
Iâ€™ve tried fantastical for a few weeks now side by side with a couple other apps, and as much as itâ€™s the one I keep going towards, I have three dealbreakers which are going to make me walk away from it at the end of the trial:

1. iOS specific- the inability to see your calendar and tasks in the same view. It may as well be two apps. I have used two other apps, one allows a drag and drop method from a task list to the calendar, and the other one brings up a mini calendar and youâ€™re able to select a slot. If either of these was built in, it would solve this issue. macOS Desktop app works perfectly!  

2: For both macOS and iOS - a lot of people rave about calendar sets, to me they are useless. Iâ€™m not saying get rid of the feature because I can see why people love them, but I need something that allows you to be a quick shortcut between the calendar view, and the settings view to toggle shared calendars on and off. If only there was a one button shortcut to go to â€œsettings > calendar & listsâ€�, this would literally solve my issue. 

There are other things I donâ€™t like, but they are not real breakers, unfortunately, these two are. Due to these two, the two things I use the most on my calendar, I have to let this app to, which is sad because it does everything else better than almost every other app out there.  

Original:
Iâ€™ve been looking for an all in one calendar/task manager. Iâ€™ve tried a handful and vowed that fantastical wouldnâ€™t cut it, but, it is the app I just keep going back to. A lot of people have complained about the change to subscription, it honestly doesnâ€™t bother me much and Iâ€™m all for supporting an app that makes my life easier to balance. But, itâ€™s not perfect, hereâ€™s what would make it â€œperfectâ€� to me. 1. It looks like it was built in 2015. It just looks d to me. I saw a video of it on Vision Pro, I would LOVE to see that UI on the iOS and desktop apps. 2. Specific to iOS: Itâ€™s a pain to manage tasks on the calendar. Other apps have a drag and drop on iOS, or a â€œscheduleâ€� button that shows you the calendar view to select the slot you want to drop the task in. With fantastical on iOS, you have to memorize the slot and then save it, if you got it wrong you can move it, but itâ€™s just extra steps. 3. Calendar groups/sets are absolutely pointless to me. Iâ€™d rather they have an easy way to toggle shared calendars on and off. Pretty much all other apps Iâ€™ve tried have it this way except for Fantastical. Iâ€™d swap out easy switches for sets literally any day of the week. 4. Calendar availability: I would like it to be more like Google calendar UX where I can look up the person and see the availability vs trying to schedule a meeting first and then checking. This is the only reason I keep going back to google calendar, you implement this I can stop going to the website. 5. Specific to iOS: widgets, there are many, but all too crowded or too big. There is one where itâ€™s â€œtodayâ€� with weather and events and takes. If â€œtodayâ€� was swapped with the actual calendar date, it would be perfect. Other than that, itâ€™s the one calendar I keep going back to. I donâ€™t know what it would take, but any (or all) the above that you could implement would make this person a very happy customer.

title: Why did you ruin your best widget?!!
content:
The whole reason why I downloaded this app in the first place is because you had a widget that shows not only the current month, but the next month too; and I really loved that because when the current month was almost over, you could look at the widget and see the days of the week of the next month, which was pretty useful for planning an event when next week is in the new month. And now you replaced it with a wide version of the one month widget. Why?!!!

At least you still have that Lock Screen widget, that displays the current week in the middle of three rows with the previous and next weeks. Itâ€™s Wednesday Sept 27 as I write this, and I really love how I can see the entire first week of October on the bottom row of the widget. Iâ€™ll keep this app for that Lock Screen widget, so please do not ruin that one too, or Iâ€™ll have no reason to keep this app any longer.

title: Embarrassing Problems
content: This app tries to be helpful with several shortcut features, but they often take effect without notice and actively create scheduling issues as a result. 1) When creating an event, if you make the mistake of putting numbers anywhere in the title, the date and/or time of the event will be changed automatically. This is a very frustrating an unnecessary feature that often creates major problems. If I select October 1 and create a new event, I do not want or need that date to be changed automatically. This feature actively sabotages a basic scheduling task. 2) Time zone shift. This is an embarrassing disaster. If you travel outside your timezone, all of your event times will shift automatically and create massive confusion. 3) Start/end time shifts. If an all-day event is multiple days long and you change the start day, the entire event will be shifted automatically instead of just the start day that you are changing. This, again, creates confusion and incorrect scheduling if you do not happen to double check every setting after making the specific adjustment. 4) Same problem with start and end times. Changing the start time of any event will automatically change the end time. It is exhausting trying to quickly schedule events when making a single adjustment results in silent, automatic changes elsewhere. I have to stop using this app because it has burned me too many times in too many various ways.

title: Overall useful but terrible event creation
content:
Overall itâ€™s a great app! Especially if youâ€™re managing multiple calendars. However, the event creation flow is not great. I use this to view my calendar but I avoid creating new events in it because itâ€™s frustrating and difficult. Iâ€™d rate the app 5 stars if the event creation flow wasnâ€™t such a frustrating experience because everything else is great. 

The event entry screen is meant to be convenient and encourage natural language parsing, but itâ€™s overly aggressive and almost always requires me to expand and type things manually. Anytime you type â€œwithâ€� in an event name, it just drops those names when creating the event because it assumes theyâ€™re inviteesâ€¦ withâ€¦ plain text names.

Further, time entry is awful and require perfect dexterity. Itâ€™s. So. Bad. Itâ€™s actually less space than if you were to enter the time with the iPhone keyboard directly: the numbers and formatting characters are RIGHT next to each other with no space so most of the time Iâ€™m making a typo. Endlessly infuriating. 

And then! After I enter an event! It snaps the calendar view back to today. WHO. DID. THIS?????? I have such a hard time with this. Iâ€™m a parent and I have to enter stuff for my kids - like soccer games - in bulk at once. The snap back after adding EACH event has made it so I didnâ€™t realize Fantastical parsed something wrong (as usual). And, because I have ADHD, I of course forgot tiny details and now have to scroll around my calendar to try and remember which thing I just inputted and by the time I find it, I forget the corrections.

And for all of the smart, natural language processing with event names, it has still never managed to figure out how to invite real people from names, even if I have a contact card or theyâ€™re in my email contacts. I invite the same handful of people to events and have to type it in manually every single time. 

In summary:
- wow event creation screen really wants you to do things one way and that one way actually messes up most of the time 
- wow entering event times is a horribly restricted amount of space  
- wow snap back to today after creating new events actively makes using this calendar hard 
- but viewing multiple calendars is great

Maybe itâ€™s time I investigate alternatives ğŸ˜�

content:

Usually by keeping reasonable pricing, being transparent about the change, and keeping existing features the same for users who already paid for the app. Fantastical has failed on all these fronts. The pricing is way too high, there are clearly obtrusive buttons prompting an already paying user to upgrade, and the new app ABSOLUTELY DOES NOT have all the same features for existing Fantastical 2 users no matter how much they try to gloss over this. They say oh no it's the same features, you just have to hand over your information, add all your calendars to our *free* account... yeah did I have to do that before? No? Then it's not the same features... This isn't a matter of "I don't like how the new version looks". People can disagree on preferences. The facts are simple: I paid for an app with certain features, now the app was updated to make some of those features inaccessible.
